name: BULETTE
senses: Darkvision 60 ft., Tremorsense 120 ft.; Passive Perception 16

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The bulette makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) Piercing damage.

actions.name: Deadly Leap
actions.text: The bulette spends 5 feet of movement to jump to a space within 15 feet that contains one or more Large or smaller creatures. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in the bulette's destination space. Failure: 19 (3d12) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage, and the target is pushed 5 feet straight away from the bulette.

bonus_actions.name: Leap
bonus_actions.text: The bulette jumps up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

raw_text:
AC 17 	Initiative +0 (10)
HP 94 (9d10 + 45)
Speed 40 ft., Burrow 40 ft.	Large Monstrosity, Unaligned
Bulette Pup
Juvenile bulettes are known as pups. They travel in small groups, using their numbers to bring down larger foes. Their arrival frequently presages the
appearance of an adult bulette.
Bullywugs
Amphibious Appreciators of Marsh and Muck
Habitat: Swamp; Treasure: Implements, Individual
Fey embodiments of swamplands, bullywugs protect the murky wilds and consider themselves cosmically favored for that role. These human-size, toad- or
frog-like creatures have close relationships with the creatures of the swamp.
Bullywug Bog Sage

Languages None

Actions
Multiattack. The bulette makes two Bite attacks.
Bite. Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft.
Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) Piercing damage.
Deadly Leap. The bulette spends 5 feet of movement to jump to a space within
15 feet that contains one or more Large or smaller creatures.
Dexterity Saving
Throw: DC 15, each creature in the bulette’s destination space.
Failure: 19
(3d12) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Prone condition.
Success:
Half damage, and the target is pushed 5 feet straight away from the bulette.
Bonus Actions
Leap. The bulette jumps up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.
